repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Functional tests call `clear()` before each test, which spawns a new neovim instance, and start using it immediately after. This forces each test to wait until the newly spawned neovim is ready.

Added a queue of 10 neovim instances that are spawned before they are needed. When `clear()` is called, the oldest instance in the queue is used. This makes it more likely that the instance is ready by the time it is needed. Queue is refilled when instances are removed from it.

This reduces total time taken by functional tests.

Note:

Since instances are created before the tests that use them, we can't use `_G._nvim_test_id` from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/8519 in e.g. `test/functional/core/log_spec.lua`, since we can't know which test will use which instance. New `_G._nvim_session_id` is introduced, which is set when the session is set.

Other places like making a temporary directory of printing the name of the test still use `_G._nvim_test_id`.

Also some of the calls to `clear()` have arguments, but since we can't predict which arguments will be passed, the optimization doesn't apply to them.

### Results

|| current | new |
|-|-|-|
ubuntu asan clang functionaltest | 14m 54s | 12m 38s |
ubuntu tsan clang functionaltest | 15m 56s | 14m 41s |
ubuntu release gcc functionaltest | 6m 30s | 6m 15s |
macos intel clang functionaltest | 9m 36s | 7m 44s |
macos arm clang functionaltest | 6m 29s | 5m 40s |
ubuntu puc-lua gcc functionaltest | 6m 46s | 6m 28s |
windows / windows (functional) | 11m 35s | 8m 34s |


<details>

<summary>data</summary>

current:
1. https://github.com/vanaigr/neovim/actions/runs/13501048829
2. https://github.com/vanaigr/neovim/actions/runs/13512336529
3. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/13549176090
4. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/13548758242
5. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/13548725467

||1|2|3|4|5|
|-|-|-|-|-|-|
| ubuntu asan clang functionaltest | 15m 26s | 14m 29s | 14m 59s | 14m 32s | 15m 2s |
| ubuntu tsan clang functionaltest | 15m 15s | 15m 57s | 16m 19s | 17m 3s | 15m 5s |
| ubuntu release gcc functionaltest | 6m 35s | 6m 19s | 6m 38s | 6m 18s | 6m 41s |
| macos intel clang functionaltest | 11m 25s | 8m 37s | 8m 51s | 9m 2s | 10m 5s |
| macos arm clang functionaltest | 6m 28s | 6m 33s | 6m 51s | 6m 19s | 6m 12s |
| ubuntu puc-lua gcc functionaltest | 6m 39s | 6m 41s | 6m 50s | 6m 46s | 6m 56s |
| windows / windows (functional) | 12m 24s | 11m 42s | 11m 20s | 11m 20s | 11m 10s |


new:
1. https://github.com/vanaigr/neovim/actions/runs/13550052710
2. https://github.com/vanaigr/neovim/actions/runs/13549525879
3. https://github.com/vanaigr/neovim/actions/runs/13539200286

||1|2|3|
|-|-|-|-|
| ubuntu asan clang functionaltest | 12m 25s | 12m 53s | 12m 36s |
| ubuntu tsan clang functionaltest | 15m 6s | 14m 14s | 14m 42s |
| ubuntu release gcc functionaltest | 6m 28s | 6m 11s | 6m 7s |
| macos intel clang functionaltest | 7m 8s | 8m 32s | 7m 31s |
| macos arm clang functionaltest | 5m 57s | 5m 23s | 5m 41s |
| ubuntu puc-lua gcc functionaltest | 6m 17s | 6m 41s | 6m 25s |
| windows / windows (functional) | 8m 36s | 8m 40s | 8m 25s |


```python
def average_times(time_lists):
    averaged_times = []
    for times in time_lists:
        total_seconds = sum(m * 60 + s for m, s in times)
        avg_seconds = round(total_seconds / len(times))
        avg_minutes, avg_seconds = divmod(avg_seconds, 60)
        averaged_times.append(f"{avg_minutes}m {avg_seconds}s")
    return averaged_times

time_data = [
    # [(12, 25), (12, 53), (12, 36)],
    ...
]

print(average_times(time_data))
```

</details>

comment_regular_data.body:
test `fileinfo does not overwrite echo message vim-patch:8.2.4156` ([link](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/0f24b0826a27b7868a3aacc25199787e7453d4cc/test/functional/legacy/messages_spec.lua#L666)) started failing because before, I assume, all 3 commands were executed at the same time since it took a long time for the test instance to become active.

Moved these two commands:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/0f24b0826a27b7868a3aacc25199787e7453d4cc/test/functional/legacy/messages_spec.lua#L683-L684

together with the previous commands. Otherwise the cursor ends up on the last character.
Converted to draft until I fix the windows test. The same test failed twice

UPD: maybe not. It should update since `:checktime` is called

> Converted to draft until I fix the windows test. The same test failed twice

~~Looks like the same thing happens as in the first failing test: neovim is ready too soon, and the test doesn't expect this.~~

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/188ec19894e4d3abadec7b9a43fecf62dd77b376/test/functional/ui/diff_spec.lua#L1559-L1565

~~The files are read (by `args` command) before they are written. Executing commands one by one leads to the same outcome.~~

~~Original oldtest sets `autoread` before writing the files:~~
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/188ec19894e4d3abadec7b9a43fecf62dd77b376/test/old/testdir/test_diffmode.vim#L1866-L1871

~~though setting it doesn't reload the files for me on windows.~~

I tried to reproduce the issue locally but couldn't.

After multiple runs, it seems that the files are not reloaded when they should. Even waiting for 100ms didn't help. But forcing reloading with `edit!` does help.

I couldn't find the source of the issue, so this is a workaround.

Run results are here:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/647cf50f588e379f7cd85008674a112fc3d707d9

@justinmk Sorry, not sure who I should ping.

I think it's better to run s390x and windows-asan tests on this PR as well.

I don't have time to work on it. It still fails on windows with diff issues, even with the workaround, but not every time. Debugging would be very time consuming, and even if it would look like all the issues are fixed, it may start failing randomly again in the future
The only non-working part is windows diff. `s390x` completes with the same number of errors as other runs around that time

:( we really need this.

> it may start failing randomly again in the future

"Randomly" because of a future mistake in the tests?

What if we disabled this for certain test files (i.e. certain test files never use the "queue"), is that hard to do?

> Since instances are created before the tests that use them, we can't use `_G._nvim_test_id` from #8519 in e.g. `test/functional/core/log_spec.lua`, since we can't know which test will use which instance. New `_G._nvim_session_id` is introduced, which is set when the session is set.

I think that's fixable without introducing `_G._nvim_session_id`. 

1. In the pooled nvim instance, call `serverstop(v:servername) ... serverstart(_nvim_test_id)` in a single RPC call. 
2. That will close the channel, but should be able to reopen with the new address.
3. That should trigger [set_vservername](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/4f141dca8c888d62b332f31fd51fa3e9b2e6cb89/src/nvim/msgpack_rpc/server.c#L203-L204), then the logs [should use](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/4f141dca8c888d62b332f31fd51fa3e9b2e6cb89/src/nvim/log.c#L341) the updated "primary name" of the Nvim sever.

If that doesn't work, we can provide some way to actually set the Nvim "primary name". That will avoid `_G._nvim_session_id`.

> I think that's fixable without introducing `_G._nvim_session_id`.

We would still need to pass something when neovim starts up? Otherwise it uses `?` and `nvim` in `.nvimlog` when it starts up.

> 1. In the pooled nvim instance, call `serverstop(v:servername) ... serverstart(_nvim_test_id)` in a single RPC call.

Running this when requesting session in a test doesn't change the name in `.nvimlog` (is uses `nvim`):
```lua
  if _G._nvim_test_id then
    -- Set the server name to the test-id for logging. #8519
    local cmd = 'vim.fn.serverstop(vim.v.servername); vim.fn.serverstart(...)'
    session:request('nvim_exec_lua', cmd, { _G._nvim_test_id })
  end
```

Removing conditional log name regen fixes this:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/957093da0da9b9875bf75a5e9f7d2305ab427204/src/nvim/log.c#L329-L337

> If that doesn't work, we can provide some way to actually set the Nvim "primary name". That will avoid `_G._nvim_session_id`.

We can also print next session ID in the test name. This way, when the gets the new session, it will have this ID.

> > it may start failing randomly again in the future
> 
> "Randomly" because of a future mistake in the tests?

Diff tests fail, and I don't know the reason. It has something to do with Windows and file change detection. 
I thought I found the issue, but then the test failed again.

And this might happen again. I would think I found the fix, and it would fail again in other places (e.g. after the PR got merged)



> What if we disabled this for certain test files (i.e. certain test files never use the "queue"), is that hard to do?

Yes, I can add an option disable it
I can't reopen the PR though. See: https://github.com/isaacs/github/issues/361
We can decide what to do with `_nvim_session_id`. Then I'll add option to disable pooling. And then open a new PR

> Removing conditional log name regen fixes this:

you mean removing the `if (regen)`? We may need to store the old value of `get_vim_var_str(VV_SEND_SERVER)` and then compare it, like:

    const char *serv = path_tail(get_vim_var_str(VV_SEND_SERVER));
    bool regen = ui || name[0] == NUL || name[0] == '?' || !strequal(serv_name, serv);

Alternatively, maybe we should introduce `v:name` (mutable), so scripts can set the Nvim "instance name". That's a bit more work though (requires design).

> We can also print next session ID in the test name. This way, when the gets the new session, it will have this ID.

I'm hoping we can avoid multiple different "IDs".

title: perf(test): pre-spawn neovim instances
